title: Bildad: No One Is Pure Before God
summary: Bildad gives a brief speech, emphasizing God's greatness and mankind’s impurity. He argues that no one can be righteous before God—not even the most upright person.

faq.question: What is Bildad’s main point?
faq.answer: That compared to God, humans are insignificant and impure.

faq.question: How long is this chapter?
faq.answer: Very short—just 6 verses, making it Bildad’s final speech.
